definition: a substance that causes an allergy
a medical condition that causes you to react badly or feel ill when you eat or touch a particular substance
an amount of money, space, etc. that is given to somebody for a particular purpose
the act of giving something to somebody for a particular purpose
a metal that is formed by mixing two types of metal together, or by mixing metal with another substance
a white substance found in many types of rock, especially clay
one of the many small spaces in each lung where gases can pass into or out of the blood
a mixture or combination of things
a mixture of mercury and another metal, used especially to fill holes in teeth
a gas with a strong smell; a clear liquid containing ammonia, used as a cleaning substance
an ion made from ammonia containing nitrogen and hydrogen together with another element
any animal that can live both on land and in water. Amphibians have cold blood and skin without scales. Frogs, toads and newts are all amphibians.
the detailed study or examination of something in order to understand more about it; the result of the study
a careful examination of a substance in order to find out what it consists of

a method of treating somebody who has problems with their mental health by asking them to talk about past experiences and feelings, and trying to help them understand fears and feelings that they were not conscious of
used to say what is most important after everything has been discussed, or considered
the scientific study of the physical structure of humans, animals or plants
the physical structure of a human, animal or plant
a person’s body
an examination of what something is like or why it happens
the art or sport of catching fish with a fishing rod
a creature that is not a bird, a fish, a reptile, an insect or a human
any living thing that is not a plant or a human
any living creature, including humans
a person who behaves in a cruel or unpleasant way, or who is very dirty
a particular type of person, thing, organization, etc.
an ion with a negative electrical charge
feelings of opposition and hate
a substance, for example penicillin, that can destroy or prevent the growth of bacteria and cure infections
a substance that the body produces in the blood to fight disease, or as a reaction when certain substances are put into the body
the activity of owning and taking care of bees
a deeply felt request for money, help or information that is needed immediately, especially one made by a charity or by the police
a quality that makes somebody/something attractive or interesting
a formal request to a court or to somebody in authority for a judgement or a decision to be changed
an indirect suggestion that any good, fair or reasonable person would act in a particular way
the practice of growing plants in water or farming fish for food
a structure for carrying water, usually one built like a bridge across a valley or low ground
a layer of rock or soil that can take in and hold water
the study or practice of growing trees and shrubs
the study of cultures of the past, and of periods of history by examining the parts of buildings and objects found in the ground
a group of islands and the sea surrounding them
the art and study of designing buildings
the design or style of a building or buildings
the design and structure of a computer system
weapons, especially large guns, bombs, tanks, etc.
the process of increasing the amount of weapons an army or a country has, especially to prepare for war
a chemical element. Arsenic is a grey metalloid (= has properties of both metals and other solid substances) and is very poisonous, especially in its compound forms.
the use of the imagination to express ideas or feelings, particularly in painting, drawing or sculpture
examples of objects such as paintings, drawings or sculptures
the skill of creating objects such as paintings and drawings, especially when you study it
art, music, theatre, literature, etc. when you think of them as a group
a type of visual or performing art
the subjects you can study at school or university that are not sciences, such as languages, history or literature
an ability or a skill that you can develop with training and practice
to learn to do something well and efficiently
an invertebrate animal such as an insect, spider or crab, that has its skeleton on the outside of its body and has joints on its legs

a soft grey mineral that does not burn and can be woven into material, used especially in the past in building as a protection against fire or to prevent heat loss. Asbestos is dangerous if you breathe it in.
the grey or black powder that is left after something, especially tobacco, wood or coal, has burnt
what is left after something has been destroyed by burning
the powder that is left after a dead person’s body has been cremated (= burned)
a forest tree with grey bark
the hard pale wood of the ash tree
the letter æ, used in Old English, and as a phonetic symbol to represent the vowel sound in cat
to behave in a way that shows that you are sorry for something that you have done
the process of fully understanding an idea or some information so that you are able to use it yourself
the process of becoming, or allowing somebody to become, a part of a country or community rather than remaining a separate group

the act of making two sounds in speech that are next to each other more similar to each other in certain ways, for example the pronunciation of the /t/ in football as a /p/; an example of this process
an official group of people who have joined together for a particular purpose
a connection or relationship between people or organizations
an idea or a memory that is suggested by somebody/something; a mental connection between ideas
a connection between things where one is caused by the other
the scientific study of the sun, moon, stars, planets, etc.
a book of maps
the mixture of gases that surrounds the earth
a mixture of gases that surrounds another planet or a star
the air in a room or in a small space; the air around a place
the feeling or mood that you have in a particular place or situation; a feeling between two people or in a group of people
a situation when people do not say anything, but feel embarrassed or uncomfortable
